org.snakeskin.runtime

Interface IRuntimePlatformBinding

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RuntimePlatformBindingSoftware

    public IRuntimePlatformBinding

    Represents the required functionality that must be implemented by a hardware platform Provides platform specific runtime calls

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IExecutor allocatePrimaryExecutor()
      Implementations should allocate, start, and return the primary runtime executor.
      IRealTimeExecutor allocateRealTimeExecutor(double rateSeconds)
      Implementations should to allocate and return a real time executor with the given rate
      IExecutor allocateSingleUseExecutor()
      Implementations should allocate, start, and return an executor which is separate from all other executors
      void blockMilliseconds(long ms)
      Implementations should block the active thread for the given number of milliseconds as precisely as possible
      double getTimestampSeconds()
      Implementations should return the relative time in seconds. This is not the wall clock time. This time should ideally be provided by a fast clock. For example, on the roboRIO, this would be the FPGA clock

    • Method Detail

      • getTimestampSeconds

        double getTimestampSeconds()

        Implementations should return the relative time in seconds. This is not the wall clock time. This time should ideally be provided by a fast clock. For example, on the roboRIO, this would be the FPGA clock

      • blockMilliseconds

        void blockMilliseconds(long ms)

        Implementations should block the active thread for the given number of milliseconds as precisely as possible

      • allocatePrimaryExecutor

        IExecutor allocatePrimaryExecutor()

        Implementations should allocate, start, and return the primary runtime executor.

      • allocateSingleUseExecutor

        IExecutor allocateSingleUseExecutor()

        Implementations should allocate, start, and return an executor which is separate from all other executors

      • allocateRealTimeExecutor

        IRealTimeExecutor allocateRealTimeExecutor(double rateSeconds)

        Implementations should to allocate and return a real time executor with the given rate
